metadata.title: CVE-2019-14318 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Crypto++ 8.3.0 and earlier contains a timing side channel in ECDSAsignature generation. This allows a local or remote attacker, able tomeasure the duration of hundreds to thousands of signing operations, tocompute the private key used. The issue occurs because scalarmultiplication in ecp.cpp (prime field curves, small leakage) andalgebra.cpp (binary field curves, large leakage) is not constant time andleaks the bit length of the scalar among other information.

criterions.comment: libcrypto++: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
